alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Harrison; Nicholas (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 27 at 11:10PM EDT until July 28 at 1:45AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM EDT FRIDAY FOR NORTH CENTRAL BOURBON, EASTERN HARRISON KY AND NORTHWESTERN NICHOLAS COUNTIES... At 1110 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2.5 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cynthiana, Millersburg, Venus, Colville, Buena Vista, Oddville, Morning Glory, Hooktown, Barefoot and Poindexter. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely and have them relay your report to the National Weather Service in Louisville.
